arm_group.description: Pregnant women who are HIV negative attending their first ANC visit
Pregnant women who are HIV positive accessing antenatal care.

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a pilot pulmonary TB screening program done in three antenatal care clinics in
      Lusaka, Zambia to determine the prevalence of culture-confirmed pulmonary tuberculosis and
      to determine the sensitivity and specificity of symptom-based TB screening.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of PTB Screening in ANC in Lusaka, Zambia

detailed_description.textblock:
5000 pregnant women attending antenatal clinics will be evaluated by piloting a TB symptom
      questionnaire as part of the general health screening done at each visit. Due to the
      atypical and subclinical presentation of TB in HIV infected patients, culture will be
      performed on all HIV-infected pregnant women, with or without symptoms, and on all
      symptomatic HIVnegative women. Referrals for TB treatment in accordance with current
      national guidelines will be offered.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnant women

          -  18 years or older

          -  HIV-negative women with any TB symptoms or HIV-infected women regardless of TB
             symptoms

          -  Attending first ANC visit at one of program clinics

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  HIV negative without any TB symptoms

intervention.description: All subjects will be screened with the questionnaire which assesses TB symptoms.
specimens for sputum microscopy and culture collected and processed in accordance with WHO TB Infection Control Guidelines
intervention.intervention_name: Sputum smear and culture (only in HIV negative women who are symptomatic)

facility.name: Centre for Infectious Disease Research in Zambia

clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Evaluation of Pulmonary Tuberculosis Screening in Antenatal Clinics in Lusaka, Zambia

overall_official.affiliation: Centre for Infectious Disease Research in Zambia
Centre for Infectious Disease Research in Zambia
Centre for Infectious Disease Research in Zambia
Centre for Infectious Disease Research in Zambia

primary_outcome.description: The prevalence of culture confirmed PTB among HIV positive and HIV negative pregnant women will be measured to determine if there is a substantial amount of undiagnosed TB in the HIV positive population accessing antenatal care.
primary_outcome.measure: number of positive pulmonary tuberculosis (PTB) tests

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

secondary_outcome.description: To determine the sensitivity and specificity of symptom based TB screening (compared to TB culture), enrollees will have TB symptoms assessed by administration of a questionnaire.  Culture will then be performed on all HIV infected pregnant women, with or without symptoms, and on all symptomatic HIV negative women.
secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity and specificity of symptom-based TB screening
